summary: An interview with Karol Orzechowski discussing his film 'Maximum Tolerated Dose' which focuses on animal experimentation and its ethical implications.

The man appears to be speaking, as indicated by his hand gestures and facial expressions. The man's expressions and gestures change slightly throughout the video, indicating an ongoing conversation or presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a single male speaker describing how he decided to tackle the topic. His tone is conversational and explanatory, he said it "wasn't a really well thought out...strategic decision." He mentions that he was already making animal rights documentaries and wanted to make a bigger contribution. In 2010, he said he met a couple people who were formerly involved with the animal experimentation industry, and it struck him there was a story there.

events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker explaining the origin of the term "maximum tolerated dose," which came up in his first interview as one of the tests to determine a drug's toxicity. He felt it was appropriate for his film because it addressed the maximum amount of pressure that humans and non-humans could endure before exiting the industry. Then there is a brief, low frequency ambient noise.

events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a male speaker discussing his personal ethical position, stating that he doesn't believe human diseases are animals' problems to solve. The speaker emphasizes he's not suggesting throwing away years of scientific progress.
